result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond - Signed by the Judge on 10/17/22
Proposed Order for Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond
Letter to the Clerk from Atty. Kautzer re: Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond
Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond - defense

Signed- cash bond posted
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Pick up personal belongings with police escort. 
Comply with day reporting requirements- GPS
Bail/bond hearing on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:38 PM Defendant Jared Thomas Riemann appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan Kautzer appeared by phone for Jared Thomas Riemann.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Court, Defense filed motion to modify bond, to allow for Deft to retrieve personal belongings with police escort. Atty Kautzer, Parties have filed a divorce action recently, needs Court approval to allow for removal of property by police escort as well as contact through my Family wizard. Court needs to reset a date as to that issue as the victim is not present to address. State, Victim is OK with Deft coming with police escort only, also would like a second no contact order with her second job. Court allows for deft to go to residence with police escort only, Court will not take up other issues today.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjournment request by Atty Kautzer

4:31 PM Defendant Jared Thomas Riemann appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan Kautzer appeared by phone for Jared Thomas Riemann.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Atty Kautzer requests to remove GPS as a condition of bond. Victim 1 on the phone, objects to the request, State objects to the request. Court denies bond motion.
Day Report Dated: 09/19/22
